contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox royalty | type = monarch | name = Feodor II | image = Tsar Fyodr II.jpg | imgw = 200px | caption = | succession = [[Tsar of All Russia]] | reign = 23 April 1605 – 10 June 1605 (N. S.) | coronation = | predecessor = [[Boris Godunov]] | successor = [[False Dmitriy I|Dmitriy II]] | spouse = | issue = | full name = Feodor Borisovich Godunov | house = [[Godunov]] | house-type = Dynasty | father = [[Boris Godunov]] | mother = [[Maria Grigorievna Skuratova-Belskaya]] | birth_date = 1589 | birth_place = | death_date = 20 June 1605<br/> (aged 16) | death_place = [[Moscow Kremlin]] | burial_date = 1605; reburied 1606 | burial_place = Varsonofy monastery, Moscow; reburied 1606 in [[Troitse-Sergiyeva Lavra]] (a separate Godunov Vault since 1783) |}} '''Fyodor II Borisovich Godunov of Russia''' ({{lang-ru|Фёдор II Борисович}}) (1589 – 10 June/20 June 1605) was a [[tsar]] of [[Russia]] (1605) during the [[Time of Troubles]]. He was born in [[Moscow]], the son and successor to [[Boris Godunov]]. His mother [[Maria Grigorievna Skuratova-Belskaya]] was one of the daughters of [[Malyuta Skuratov]], the infamous favourite of [[Ivan the Terrible]]. [[Image:Fedor chertezh.jpeg|thumb|left|Fedor Godunov's map of Russia, as published by Hessel Gerritsz.]] [[File:Makovsky False Dmitrys agents murdering Feodor Godunov and his mother 1862.jpg|thumb|left|''False Dmitry's Agents Murdering Feodor Godunov and his Mother'', by [[Konstantin Makovsky]] (1862). [[Tretyakov Gallery]], Moscow.]] Physically robust and passionately beloved by his father, he received the best education available at that time, and from childhood was initiated into all the minutiae of government, besides sitting regularly in the [[Duma|council]] and receiving the foreign [[diplomat|envoy]]s. He seems also to have been remarkably and precociously intelligent, creating a map of Russia, which is still preserved.<ref>[http://www.nlr.ru:8101/exib/siberia/sibi4.htm Картографирование Сибири]</ref> It was edited with some additions by [[Hessel Gerritsz]] in [[Amsterdam]], in 1613, and reedited until 1665. On the sudden death of Boris the sixteen-year-old was proclaimed tsar (13 April 1605). Though his father had taken the precaution to surround him with powerful friends, he lived from the first moment of his reign in an atmosphere of treachery. On 11 June (N. S.) 1605 the envoys of [[False Dmitriy I|Pseudo-Demetrius I]] (or False Dmitriy I) arrived at Moscow to demand his removal, and the letters which they read publicly in [[Red Square]] decided his fate. A group of [[boyar]]s, unwilling to swear allegiance to the new tsar, seized control of the [[Moscow Kremlin|Kremlin]] and arrested him. On 10/20 June Feodor was strangled in his apartment, together with his mother. Officially, he was declared to have been poisoned, but the Swedish diplomat [[Peter Petreius]] stated that the bodies, which had been on public display, showed traces of a violent struggle.<ref>Peter Petreius de Erlesund: ''Historien und Bericht von dem Groszfürstentumb Muschkow'', Leipzig, 1630</ref> Although aged 16 at best, Feodor was known to be physically strong and agile and apparently it took four men to overpower him.<ref>R. G. Skrynnikov: ''Boris Godunov'', Moscow: Nauka, 1978/1983 and Gulf Breeze, Fla: Academic International Press, 1978/1982, ISBN 0-87569-046-7</ref> ==See also== *[[Tsars of Russia family tree]] ==References== *{{1911}} {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-reg}} {{succession box|title=[[List of Russian rulers|Tsar of Russia]]|before=[[Boris Godunov|Boris I]]|after=[[False Dmitriy I|Dmitriy II]]|years=1605}} {{s-roy|ru}} {{succession box | before=[[Tsarevich Dmitry Ivanovich of Russia (born 1582)|Dmitriy Ivanovich]]| title=[[List of heirs to the Russian throne|Heir to the Russian Throne]] | years=1598–1605| after=[[Sigismund III Vasa]] }} {{s-end}} {{Sovereign Rulers of Russia}} {{Tsarevich of Russia}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Feodor 02 Of Russia | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1589 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 20 June 1605 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Moscow Kremlin]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Feodor 02 Of Russia}} [[Category:1589 births]] [[Category:1605 deaths]] [[Category:1605 crimes]] [[Category:Russian leaders]] [[Category:Russian tsars]] [[Category:Imperial Russian cartographers]] [[Category:Murdered Russian monarchs]] [[Category:Orthodox monarchs]] [[Category:Leaders ousted by a coup]] [[Category:Murdered royalty]] {{Link GA|ru}}
